channel.title: What do if my logindecoder does not work [FIXED]

item.title: What do if my logindecoder does not work [FIXED]
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“wildskiller, post:4, topic:540349”][quote author=Arcik link=topic=659205.msg4408700#msg4408700 date=1392842062]

break; instead of return true; whenever you switch the state.

Makes no difference.

Edit: Derped, I needed to declare LoginState outside the method because when the method was called it would reset the state back to the connection block. Everything is working fine.

Been doing retarded mistakes lately ;(
[/quote]

They do make a difference. Returning true/false will end the boolean right there. Using ‘break’ breaks, or ends, the switch block and continues to the end of the method.[/quote]
I know what they do, I met in my case it didn’t matter because I want the buffer resetting every method call.
Thanks though.

Read full topic
item.source: What do if my logindecoder does not work [FIXED]

item.title: What do if my logindecoder does not work [FIXED]
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:3, topic:540349”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=659205.msg4408687#msg4408687 date=1392840892]

break; instead of return true; whenever you switch the state.
[/quote]
Makes no difference.

Edit: Derped, I needed to declare LoginState outside the method because when the method was called it would reset the state back to the connection block. Everything is working fine.

Been doing retarded mistakes lately ;([/quote]

They do make a difference. Returning true/false will end the boolean right there. Using ‘break’ breaks, or ends, the switch block and continues to the end of the method.

Read full topic

item.title: What do if my logindecoder does not work [FIXED]
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

AtomicInt_:

break; instead of return true; whenever you switch the state.

Makes no difference.

Edit: Derped, I needed to declare LoginState outside the method because when the method was called it would reset the state back to the connection block. Everything is working fine.

Been doing retarded mistakes lately ;(

Read full topic
